HierarchicalRequirement._refObjectName: As an admin user, I can create/read/update/delete a product record and its attributes
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
Acceptance Criteria:

  • Only admin users may access the CRUD product UI. Non-admin users are redirected to an "unauthorized", user-friendly error page.
  • Users can add, edit, and delete one product at a time.
  • Product Fields:
    • Name (required)
    • Alternate Name (optional)
    • Designation (required)
    • Summary (optional)
    • Inactive Date (optional)
  • Users can associate or disassociate attributes with each product.


Detailed User Stories

CREATE_PRODUCT:  As an admin user, I want to create a new product record so:

  • I navigate to the 'Add/Edit Products' shown under the System Administration Menu (note - only shown if I'm admin)
  • The system shows a screen allowing me to select a product or to add a new product
  • I select add a new product
  • The system prompts me to enter a name (required), designation (required), summary, and alternate name for the product
  • The system adds the newly created product to the list of products to edit and preselects it
  • The system displays a list of master attributes for all products (grouped appropriately) and allows me to select the ones i want to initially add to the product
  • (Step #7) I select 'Edit Product' (note - this is only enabled if a product is selected)
  • The system creates the product and assigns the selected attributes to it
  • The system shows me a grid edit for the product showing all attributes (Name, value, unit of measure, source) where I can edit value, unit of measure and source for each
    • For LIST types of attributes, I'm constrained to picking values from a multilist
    • For BOOLEAN values, I'm constrained to setting a checkbox
    • For DATE values. I'm constrained to picking a valid date (calendar control)
    • For FILE/IMAGE values - I'm constrained to picking a file/image via an upload dialog (upload from my local machine
  • I can press the Add/Remove attributes button to change the attributes attached to the product
    • The system presents a popout showing the list of attributes (as previously shown in the filter)
    • I can select/deselect what I want to add/remove
    • When done - I press 'OK"
    • The system returns to the product grid edit with the appropriate attributes added/removed
    • ALT:  I can press 'CANCEL' and return to the product grid edit as before (no changes made)
  • I can press the Comparison/Competitor button to add/remove competitors & comparable products
    • The system presents a popup showing the list of comparable & competing products
    • I can select/deselect what I want to add/remove
    • The system returns to the product grid edit with the appropriate competitors/comparables added/removed
    • ALT:  I can press 'CANCEL' and return to the product grid edit as before (no changes made)
  • I can press the Clone button to make a copy of this product
    • TODO:  How to handle clone?
  • (Step #13)When I'm finished I press Save
  • ALT:  If I navigate away from the page without having pressed save - the system does not save the added/changed product or associate it with any competitors/comparables
  • The system validates the data
    • TODO:  put validation information here

READ/UPDATE_PRODUCT:  Ads an admin user, I want to view and/or edit an existing product so:

  • I navigate to the 'Add/Edit Products' shown under the System Administration Menu (note - only shown if I'm admin)
  • The system shows a screen allowing me to select a product or to add a new product
  • I select a product from the dropdown list of all products
  • {Proceed from step #7 in CREATE_PRODUCT - the system does not create a new product in step #8, but rather retrieves the existing product/data}

DELETE_PRODUCT:  Ads an admin user, I want to delete an existing product so:

  • Proceeds as READ/UPDATE_PRODUCT
  • At Step #13, an alternative course is to press the 'Delete' button
  • The system confirms that I meant to delete the product
  • If I confirm, the Product is marked as deleted and no longer appears in any product lists and is no longer editable/accessable
  • If I dont confirm, I return to READ/UPDATE_PRODUCT
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: As an admin user, I can create/read/update/delete a product record and its attributes
